intro: Linosyris candicans, commonly known as the showy linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent white markings. Linosyris candicans is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
